adjectives.description: chagrined (comparative more chagrined, superlative most chagrined)

entries.meaning: Feeling chagrin (at something); vexed; fretful. [First attested in the early 18th century, replacing the adjective chagrin.]
examples: She was chagrined to note that the paint had dried into a blotchy mess.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of chagrin
